column1: KEY-PAIR is used to connect to a virtual machine.
1) using ec2 instance  where u can directly connect.
2) using ssh keys. paste the ssh key in windows powershell in the directory of ur .pem file.
(ubutnu will contain default git. u don't have to install)
sudo apt-get update -> update ur repository
sudo docker ps  ->present status of running containers
git clone http of maven-web application
- here u should get pom.xml file
access the application with public ip of ec2 instance(auto-assigned ip address)
MINIKUBE: in windows powershell run as administrator
delete an exisiting deployment: kubectl delete pod <podname>
kubectl create deployment mynginx  --image=archanareddycse/oltrs (if u don't have an image in docker hub use nginx instead of archanareddyxse)

6) kubectl get deployments --lists the deployments   -> in the ready column of mynginx if u get 0/1 it is an error. it will not execute when you expose deployment. in this case create the deployment again with mynginx1. it should be 1/1
10) kubectl get service mynginx  -> you should get service port number
11) paste the port number in local host you shoule get welcome to nginx ->localhost:81
if you dint get the port number you have to do tunnelling -> kubectl port-forward svc/mynginx 81:80
copy the url(authentication token) from the website and paste in the ngrok command prompt
1) ngrok.exe http <Jenkins port number> ->example port number:8081 -> u will get ngrok dialog box with forwarding url
